column3: A related issue is that I couldn't find an unexpired version of @sipa's key, neither on `keys.openpgp.org` (which does not sync with other servers) nor somewhere else.
Wouldn't it make sense to update https://bitcoincore.org/en/contact/ as well, assuming that `keyserver.ubuntu.com` is non-functioning?

> Wouldn't it make sense to update [bitcoincore.org/en/contact](https://bitcoincore.org/en/contact/) as well, assuming that `keyserver.ubuntu.com` is non-functioning?\n\n`keyserver.ubuntu.com` is functioning but I think we should just keep the keyserver consistent everywhere.
I think they don't accept any key updates, do they?

Review ACK 90f1f849e9f5a0c1855b72824af38b9aa24d5287

> keyserver.ubuntu.com is functioning but I think we should just keep the keyserver consistent everywhere.

I agree. Ideally we would not have to suggest any keyserver. It's frustrating enough to have to play keyserver ping-pong every time when yet another part of PGP infrastructure goes down, but it seems `keys.openpgp.org` works for no
